{include "affiliate_loader"} Now, urge the governor to sign it into law. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

New Jersey is about to make history. Thanks to your actions and support, the New Jersey Legislature passed the Public Health Emergency Credit Bill today – a groundbreaking COVID-19 decarceration bill that will speed up the releases of more than 2,500 people who are nearing the end of their sentences.

Governor Murphy has indicated that he will sign the bill into law. Urge him to swiftly sign S2519/A4235 into law. Lives are at stake.

Take Action

Lawmakers have recognized the urgency of this unprecedented moment, and used their power to release thousands of people from a prison system with the worst COVID-19 prison death rate and Black-white prison disparity in the county. Now it's Governor Murphy's turn. Urge the governor to act now and quickly sign this bill into law.

The glacial pace at which the New Jersey Department of Corrections has responded to the outbreak of COVID-19 in its facilities have denied dozens of people more than justice – it's denied them their lives, said Senator Nellie Pou, one of the bill's prime sponsors.

Every minute counts. Urge Governor Murphy to sign S2519/A4235 swiftly into law.

In solidarity,

{/if}

{affiliate_ed_name}
Executive Director, ACLU of {affiliate_name}
